The isis padding-hello command configures a P2P interface to send Hello packets with the padding field after the neighbor relationship is established.
The undo isis padding-hello command restores the default configuration. The isis padding-hello command configures a P2P interface to send Hello packets with the padding field after the neighbor relationship is established. The undo isis padding-hello command restores the default configuration. By default, a P2P interface sends Hello packets without the padding field after the neighbor relationship is established.
